Package de.rumford.tradingsystem.helper

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.rumford.tradingsystem.helper.Util
  • public final class Util
extends Object
    Utility class as used throughout the library containing solely of static methods representing mainly mathematical calculations.
    Author:
    Max Rumford

    • Method Detail

      • adjustForStandardDeviation

        public static double adjustForStandardDeviation​(double value,
                                                double standardDeviation)
        Adjusts a given value for the given standard deviation
        Parameters:
        value - double value to be adjusted
        standardDeviation - double standard deviation to be adjusted for
        Returns:
        double standard deviation adjusted value. Double.NaN, if the given standard deviation is zero.

      • calculateAverage

        public static double calculateAverage​(double[] values)
        Calculates the average value of the given array of values.
        Parameters:
        values - double[] An array of values.
        Returns:
        double The average value of the given values.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given array is null.

      • calculateCorrelationOfRows

        public static double[] calculateCorrelationOfRows​(double[][] valuesMatrix)
        Calculate the correlations between the given array of value arrays.
        Parameters:
        valuesMatrix - double[][] An array of n arrays of values.
        Returns:
        double[] The correlations between the given rows as by PearsonsCorrelation.getCorrelationMatrix().
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given array is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given array does not contain exactly 3 values.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given array contains null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given array contains arrays containing null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given array contains arrays containing Double.NaN.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given array contains arrays not of the same length.

      • calculateForecast

        public static double calculateForecast​(double unscaledForecast,
                                       double scalar)
        Scales the forecast based on the given scalar
        Parameters:
        unscaledForecast - double unscaled forecast to be scaled
        scalar - double scalar to scale the unscaled forecast
        Returns:
        double the scaled forecast

      • calculateForecastScalar

        public static double calculateForecastScalar​(double[] values,
                                             double baseScale)
        Calculates the forecast scalar for the given array of values in the scale of the given base scale. Formula: F = baseScale / [ sum( |fc| ) / n ] Base scale divided by the average of absolutes.
        Parameters:
        values - double[] values to be scaled by the forecast scalar
        baseScale - double base scale for scaling of the forecast scalar
        Returns:
        double forecast scalar to scale the given values to fit the given scalar base. Returns Double.NaN if the average of absolute values is 0
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the average of the absolutes of the given values is zero
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given baseScale is zero

      • calculateReturn

        public static double calculateReturn​(double formerValue,
                                     double latterValue)
        Calculates the difference between two values in percentage points of change as seen from the former value
        Parameters:
        formerValue - double value the value of the difference is based on
        latterValue - double "new" value which represents a changed value in comparison to formerValue
        Returns:
        double difference between formerValue and latterValue represented in percentage points. Double.NaN if the given formerValue is zero.

      • calculateWeightsForThreeCorrelations

        public static double[] calculateWeightsForThreeCorrelations​(double[] correlations)
        Calculate the weights that should be given to the rows of values making up the given correlations. Expects an array of length 3, where position 0 holds the correlation of rows A and B, position 1 holds the correlation for rows A and C, and position 2 holds the correlation for rows B and C.
        Parameters:
        correlations - double[] Three values representing the correlations between the rows A, B and C. The expected array is constructed as follows: { corr_AB, corr_AC, corr_BC }. See Validator.validateCorrelations(double[]) for limitations.
        Returns:
        double[] The calculated weights { w_A, w_B, w_C }.
